Reviews.Title: “Only book as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: nasus29
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel out of desperation due to financial restraints of our daughter and her boyfriend who are spending a year travelling in Australia on a small budget. It was booked through Hotel .com whom my husband has used many times and been extremely pleased with the standard of hotels booked. This particular hotel was like a run down/tired hostel. Ugly rooms, stained carpets, loose wiring hanging away from the wall, inaccesible window which you could just about see the sky if you strained your head & neck, dirty/marked walls. Our daughter and her boyfriend had to be moved room as rain soaked their bed during the first night. The room they were moved to was damp and had black mould on the walls inside & outside the bathroom so they were moved again. As a goodwill gesture we were given 4 free breakfasts - much appreciated. On the plus side, there was always fresh linen and towels and the beds were quite comfortable and the hotel was generally quiet. The hotel was ideally located for Darling harbour. Hotel staff were courteous and helpful. Unfortunately we would not recommend this establishment to anyone and have reported our disgust to the booking company.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but needs work”
Reviews.Author: MissRon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in mid-February when I was attending a concert and chose this hotel as it was a 5 minute walk from the concert venue. I had read the reviews and decided that since it was just one night, was affordable and located right where i needed to be, i was willing to take the chance. i for one found the girls on the front desk extremely lovely. they were both very nice, chatty and helpful. i arrived a bit earlier than the check-in time so sat and waited and the girls kept me informed as to status of my room. when i did get to check-in, i had been upgraded. yes, the lift is old and creaky but it works. when i arrived, the cleaning staff were in the middle of getting all the rooms ready so there were bags of garbage and linen strewn along the corridor. i did find this a bit ominous and does not make for good presentation. the room i was given had a queen bed and two lots of bunk beds. there was a small table, with tea/coffee making items, a wardrobe and not much else. for a room meant to sleep 6, i was rather dubious. i was perfectly happy though as it was just me. the aircon was a bit noisy but it worked however it is situated right above one of the beds so whoever sleeps there will most likely freeze! i wasn't disturbed by outside noise at all. i am an extremely light sleeper and suffer insomnia but hardly heard anything from the street outside my window. the bathroom is old and a bit run down but the water pressure in the shower was great and the water temp was lovely. the knob that controls the ceiling fan was missing and i found that my electronic key and door lock weren't a fan of each other so took me several attempts each time i wanted to enter the room. the bed was comfortable but dipped in the middle so 2 people would have been on top of each other. in all, i'd probably stay here again as i'm really not that fussy about where i sleep so long as its clean, and as a single woman feel safe, which i did, there was an issue with noise from another room but they quietened down at a reasonable hour. the sad thing is that with some work, this could be a quaint boutique hotel. still, as i said earlier, i'd probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “never ever again”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaDavidFrost
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and was booked in for 3 nights it was so bad I ended up moving out on the 2nd night and moving to the marriot hotel and paid the $300.00 for this. This hotel does not even deserve 1 star and I would like to contact the company who rates rooms and discuss.

Reviews.Title: “Not value or style. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: brians101
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with the quality of the entire complex, and in particular our room. Also found their practice of charging our credit card with $100, that they say would be refunded 5-7 days later, only to find that there was no nothing to take or damage if we had wanted to. Not a pleasing experience, but thats not to say the staff we dealt with weren't reasonable. They were.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: amiga4
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the city centre and are on a budget, Aarons is the place to go. Don't expect a great hotel room - they're functional, clean, and that's about it. You're paying for the location, not a wonderful room in a great hotel. I have stayed here a couple of times now and would stay again. To be honest the furnishings could be updated, but then if they did that, I have no doubt the price would increase. It's hot during summer if you're on the top floor, but windows do open to try to cool things down. Even at the back of the hotel though, it got a but noisy early in the morning if the windows are left open all night. Overall, it's great value if you want to stay in the centre of Sydney and cannot afford to pay $200+ per night!

Reviews.Title: “Not again even if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: nzwccw
Reviews.Content: My room was no. 215 on the 2nd floor. The lift was not working. The room was small and facing Paddy's Market which was noisy even at 1am. Street light was shinning in through the bath room window at night. The best thing is the location which is in the centre of Chinatown, close to the central train station, and trams are at the doorstep. But I'd rather pay a bit more next time when I'm in Sydney. It's definitely not 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: inkaradise
Reviews.Content: It's not often that I would have to rethink what the difference between two things would be, and I had always thought that difference between a hotel and a motel would be clear. Unfortunately, this was more of a motel, and didn't quite live up to the brochure our travel agent showed us. Another problem we had was with the very late check in time at about 1pm if I remember correctly, and early check out time of 10am, though they did offer us to store our luggage when we needed. The bedrooms are fairly small, and the bathrooms especially so, but the beds are quite comfortable and the room service prompt and polite, though the rooms themselves seemed fairly old, even in a heritage building. The location and price are the main draws, and for the usual prices it's reasonable for a place in the middle of Chinatown, and only 15 minutes walk to just about anywhere in the CBD, as well as being 2 minutes walk to the Central train station. One thing mentioned before is the noise, and if you can't deal with street sweepers late at night/early hours, try somewhere else Nonetheless, it was still a pleasant stay, and most of the staff were very helpful and professional, with the exception of one who could not deal with an issue about buying wifi access one night, even though a different one easily solved it an hour later. As uni students, we could have done much worse for the price (we got a 3 nights for 2 deal), but not a stay for those who don't mind spending the money somewhere much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud street noise ... not a hotel for sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: Mike-OWaterloo
Reviews.Content: I was bumped here when my booked hotel had trouble with their hot water plumbing ... they "upgraded" me to a bigger room, but honestly I didn't need the extra space. I would rather have had a decent night's sleep! The bottom line is that the window in my room was an ancient (and dirty) single-glazed sash window that let in *every* sound from the street: drunks, garbage trucks etc. Even with heavy duty earplugs, I still woke up! Given the large number of similar negative comments on this site, you would think they would do some renos, at least on the windows. Aside from that major negative, the room was generally clean although charmless. The corridors reminded me of the poorest Uni dorm. Bathroom was a surreal pale green plastic colour. But the location is convenient for Central station.

Reviews.Title: “So awful it was laughable.”
Reviews.Author: Laurali14
Reviews.Content: Firstly I noticed a squished mosquito with blood up the wall and something that looked a lot like snot on the wall. Every single sound from outside could be heard... including the dump truck in the middle of every night. The shower had a lot of mould and the TV wasn't digital and most of the channels were too blurred to watch. We ordered late check out which they obviously didnt write down because my friend got locked out of the room at 10am (lucky I was still inside) and then they rang us and asked why we hadn't left. Lastly the restaurant is actually at a different hotel a few streets away...and though I will say some of the staff were really polite, others were not at all!

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough..”
Reviews.Author: goggles4u
Reviews.Content: The place was very average... The windows let in every sound, so during the night the trucks and street sweepers sounded like they were in the room with us.. The desk didn't get any of our package correct and blamed the fact that they had so many offers for the confusion.. We had late checkout as part of the package,... I happened to confirm, and it wasn't marked, so they did give it to us, but when we went to our room at 11am we found we were locked out.. The whole place is run down.. They had a notice of intention to build up in reception, so I had a look thinking it was good they were renovating, but no, they are planning to take over the shop next door and open a bottle shop.. The breakfast was over a blocks walk to another hotel.. The location was excellent, but after being there and seeing all the other hotels in the same excellent location, we will never stay there again no matter how good the price is..

Reviews.Title: “Suited for party goers.”
Reviews.Author: melfromaustralia
Reviews.Content: Rooms spacious and clean and very basic. A lot of drunk young people screaming till 5am up and down the corridors. Because its fairly cheap it attracts a much younger crowd who have no respect for people trying to sleep. Unfortunately can't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For budget travellers with low expectations”
Reviews.Author: Rob074
Reviews.Content: I booked into a standard room alone. If I'd had my husband with me, both of us would not have been able to turn around in the room, let alone the bathroom. I asked for an upgrade which they gave me at no extra cost. The staff were very polite and friendly. The second room was much better but generally the hotel is in need of a major upgrade. The towels are very thin and not comfortable, there was no view (an air conditioner blocked the view out of the window), and the garbage trucks drive right past the hotel at 3 am making a huge racket. Either that or it's the fresh produce being delivered to all the Chinese restaurants very early in the morning. Absolutely no frills. Had to walk two blocks away to have breakfast (in a much better hotel). Breakfast was usual fare - not outstanding. There were loads of school kids and busloads of people so you had to pick your time for breakfast. The general area (lobby, lift, corridors) are all very old and in disrepair. The good side was a fantastic location in Chinatown near Paddy's Markets and the harbourside. Very convenient. I certainly would not stay there again and would not suggest having it on a list of recommended accommodation for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: JLI323
Reviews.Content: We were travelling around Asia and Australia, and had just arrived from luxurious hotel in Hong Kong to Aarons hotel in Sydney...and I'll not lie, I could have cried! The hotel is like an upmarket hostel, but once you get over the shock it is O.K for a quick stoppover in Sydney. We were there 5 days. The staff are really friendly. The hotel is dated and the rooms are very basic. But accomodation in Sydney is expensive and unfortunately we were not willing to pay the prices! The room was cold but once we got the heating working it was fine, and the bathroom did resemble a cabin in a caravan, but it was basic and clean. Location wise, it is situated in the middle of China town. Although we were not entirely hooked on this idea, we knew this before we went so were prepared! We got the train straight in from the airport, and the station was literally a 5minute walk so that was definitely a huge advantage. It is also really close to the hop on hop off tourbus stop, so again that was handy. We did walk the whole way to the opera house on one occassion - it is a long walk but it is definitely do-able if you dont mind walking! The hotel is very basic, and I was initially shocked. But it is a budget hotel and quite clean, so it is suited for a brief stay in Sydney. Location great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Judy E
Reviews.Content: Very very dissappointed.Had a booking for Family fun package & receive buffet breakfast, free playstation hire, bottle of wine & 1 voucher for either a game of skirmish or bowling which i must add was added to our account. On booking in, we received none of the above nor were we offered any of the above.We were also told the restaraunt was closed for renovations. When we entered our room, the smell was so bad my 8 yr grandson said "Granma you have to be kidding, i am not staying in this room it stinks so bad" My 6yr old granddaughter agreed. We were moved to another room that smelt marginally better. There was no fresh air in the building. The room were advertised as family rooms which i concider barely legal for 4 people. The air conditioner blew directly onto the bottom bunk & was impossible to sleep with the noise directly above the bed. My grandsons DS 3D went missing to boot. It was one of the wost experiences i have had in a hotel. The only thing i can reccomend is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Think about the family staying there”
Reviews.Author: Nicholsp01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of Hotels in Sydney. The ANA, the Nikko, the Regent and the Intercontinental to just name a few. These were all using other people's money (OPM). I have also stayed at a few budget places like the YHA backpackers and Hotel Ibis near Chinatown. This time I was visiting Sydney with my own money and with my wife, her very particular 73 year old father, and three children; Sam (8), Leah (5) and Julius (2). Comparing it to the Hotel Intercontinental, I have to give this Hotel a 2 out of five rating. The carpets were grubby, there was no bell boy (although the staff were willing to help if asked), there was a light bulb missing from a light stand, the elevator rattled, a tap handle screwed itself off on the shower and the outside windows were dirty. There were always washing bags in the corridor and parking costs were extra and not on site. But the real question to ask about accommodation is would you stay there again and that is a definite, YES. Allow me to explain: When with a family, it is a father's job to make sure the family is happy and safe and the costs don't break the budget. Sure, if money was not an issue I would probably stay at the York or a serviced apartment. Arrons was cheaper than the YHA backpackers. The father-in-law loved the very high ceilings in the room. This is very important with six people sharing the same room. It gives breathing space. It reminded me of my favourite hotel in Melbourne, the Windsor. The whole hotel is non smoking, which is great. The building must has been an old warehouse because the walls were thick brick. The complaints about noise in the other reviews may have been about my kids screaming (as kids do), but I felt better knowing how thick the walls were. We walked to the Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife, the Australian Museum, St Marys and the Fish Market. The free kids playground within 5 min walk at Darling Harbour was a real blessing. Every night of our three night stay we enjoyed, steam chicken, BBQ Pork and Roast Duck with assorted tasties in our room ( a screaming 2 year old in a nice restaurant is not an enjoyable experience for anyone). All of this wonderful food was very cheap and available just around the corner from the hotel. Late shopping at paddies markets (across the road) gave us buckets of cherries, nectarines, grapes, peaches, pears and all the natural goodies for children who will not always eat as much vegetables as you would like. Each bucket was selling for $1 as the growers were trying to get rid of their stock at the end of the day. Many reviews have talked about the elevator, but the place only has a few floors and we mostly used the stairs. Sure it is an issue when carrying heavy luggage, but that should only be twice during the stay and a slightly slow elevator is not cause of stress. The location has been said to be the best part of the hotel, but in my view, the best part of the stay was the cheerful and helpful attitude of the staff. They know their hotel is not perfect yet and they will do whatever they can to make you more comfortable. If you don't like your room, just tell them. The kids loved the Sony Playstation they could borrow from the front and I must say that the staff, no matter who was on duty, was always kind, helpful and professional. The family was happy, could rest well and were safe. I assume with time, the facilities and fittings at this hotel will get better. I just hope they don't spend so much money that they put up the rates. Read into the low reviews of this hotel and you will see most complaints as being about trivial issues. If you are not on a tight budget, stay in a serviced apartment. If you are travelling alone and want to meet people, stay at the youth hostel. If you are stressed out by any blemish or find the occasional noise from other kids etc, intolerable, then stay somewhere else. If you are on a budget, with a family and want to be in the city, this is a good choice. Thank you to the staff at Arrons for giving us a happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Rose10022
Reviews.Content: i must say that i was surprised and dissappointed with aarons hotel... when people talk about hotels, you usually expect that your luggage would be taken for you, good service and polite and friendly staff. upon arrival, my experience was anything but that. when we arrived, we were rushed to get the luggage out of the car as it was a no parking zone. nobody came to help us with our luggage. ok, nevermind. that could have been dismissed as inattentiveness of the staff. however, when we went up to the reception and asked if there was a bell boy, the receptionist(who wasn't wearing a name tag and would not give her name) answered rudely that there was no bell boy. then when we asked if there was a trolley, the girl answered impatiently that there was one and just pointed to the trolley and offered no help. we then moved our luggage in ourselves. we went up to pay for the room bookings. the receptionist gave us the papers with an air of impatience. she then said," you would need to deposit a hundred dollars for damages" and gave us a look. what i didn't like was that she said it with a pompous air and looked at us as if we were something the dog dragged in. after we had paid up, she printed out the receipts but failed to give us one that acknowledged the hundred dollar deposit we gave that was claimable upon check out. when we brought this to her notice by saying," excuse me, there is no acknowledgement of our reclaimable deposit in the receipt" she answered briskly,"oh, i just didn't type it in" in a dismissive tone of voice. we insisted on it and she printed one with a sour look on her face. But having said all that, i must also say that other staff aside from those two receptionists were friendly and helpful. The rooms were ok but the toilet was really small and the door was alarming. it was a sliding door that was only attached to the top rail and there was no bottom rail. it made me feel insecure as the door always felt like it would drop off anytime and anyone could just pull the door open easily. This experience spoilt our mood and view of sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but terrible room!”
Reviews.Author: INNALOO
Reviews.Content: Didn't booked a room as it a was last minute decision to fly into Sydney for 2 nights. It was a busy week for Sydney as it had 2 major events held simultaneously. Found the hotel after searching several hotels in the vicinity. The reception staff was helpful, as it was too early for check in, they allow me to deposit my luggage. Upon exiting from the lift, was shock that the corridor only have fans. Upon entering the room, the aircon is a window casement type that was quite noisy. The room is basic with a small cabinet and a small flat screen tv. The bathroom was basic with a bricked up shower area that you have to virtually lift up your leg into the shower area. After returning to the room after dinner, was shock to see small cockroaches in the bathroom near the sink and the tv table!

Reviews.Title: “A real vacation ruining experience”
Reviews.Author: Barron6
Reviews.Content: In short, we left there more tired than when we arrived. This was the best example of an optical illusion that Iâ€™ve run across. While the picture does reflect the actual room, the picture quality, angles and drawn curtains hide important clues. To start with, this hotel is a minimally converted former factory, +100 years old. The picture in the lobby (and on the website) shows this. Thereâ€™s no soundproofing or wall insulation. In fact, those clean walls you see in the picture are cinder blocks (now with drywall nailed to them) used to construct the original building. Donâ€™t look past those drapes in the room we stayed in, they reveal the back alley. We heard trucks coming and going all night as they were delivering goods to the markets across the alley. The single pane windows look like theyâ€™re original, single pane. The panes rattle, so any breeze will wake you up (if you happen to fall asleep). The shower was made of cinder block too. Note that the hotel was newly renovated (to them this means new paint only). It was a gloomy and disheartening experience for us. We came from the US and this was supposed to be the highlight of our stay. We wound up doing anything to keep from going back to the room during our 2-day stay and got depressed when it was time to go back. The staff was nice and did the best they could to accommodate us. I felt sorry for them.. they were really trying to make the best of the situation they were in. Though they never said it, it was clear to us that they realized this was a dump. As for the manager, when we complained to him about the room, he mocked us and would not give us a refund that amounted to anything. It amounted to 10% of what we paid. After exhausting all reasoning I could muster with him, my wife fired off at him like anyone would. I remember folding my arms while letting her vent and thinking, â€œthe minute he says something out of line to her, Iâ€™m gonna get â€˜em!â€�. I think he sensed this because he was less rude and arrogant, and stayed in line. Truthfully, I would not have gotten physical with him as I was a guest in his country. I knew it would be more trouble than it was worth for us. Throughout this encounter, there was a group of middle school kids and teachers behind who were rooting us on. They had the same terrible experience. To add insult to injury, the day after we checked-in we found another hotel about 2 blocks away. We decided to check it out and asked if we could see the rooms. While the building was an older one, the rooms had real walls, large double-pane glass and they were plush and quiet. They were only about 140.00 a night, 8 dollars more than Aarons. If we were staying longer I would have taken that loss and moved there. I cannot remember the name of it, but I remember it had 5 or 6 floors. You can imagine how we felt. We booked this little excursion while in Melbourne to get away from a cold spell, so this was done on short notice. We trusted the travel agency knew enough to get us what we asked for... obviously, our trust was partly misplaced. In their defense, the star rating in their info and the (1} picture of Aarons looked good. It was enough to fool them, and us. Iâ€™ve learned never to book a trip on short notice and do your own research. Now, the first leg of our trip to the Gold Coast was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Big City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracey010269
Reviews.Content: Welll....I guess for the price in a big city, the hotel was ok. It was clean but extremely basic. It was located on a main street so quite noisy. It was just an overnight stay while in transit so it was okay for one night, but quite some distance from the airport (on their advertisement it said less than 1km from the airport which was not correct).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Daigoro1423
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights (a Thursday and Friday night). Pros: Staff were very helpful. Great location (walking distance to most places in the CBD). Cons: Noisy area (couple shouting in the street on Thursday night, couple shouting in the hotel's corridor on Friday night!). Air-conditioner in the window (which runs continuously and cannot be turned off) was a little noisy. Difficult to block out orange street lights with curtains. TV was basic, standard definition, some dodgy reception. Other: Room was large, functional but comfortable enough. Shower took a while to warm up, but was fine once going. Overall: I would stay here again, not to "enjoy" the room and hotel, but because the location and price are great. Unfortunately it can be a noisy area, but that can't be helped because it is a busy area, with lots of people through the day and night. Not a bad place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Humble, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: KoraCostar
Reviews.Content: A last minute dash to Sydney for the NRL grand final, meant everything was booked out. We were lucky to get a executive room at the Aaron. A humble, older type hotel,but the room was clean, the linen fresh and crisp and the location was very convenient and close to Central Station. Paddy's Market, Darling Harbour and Chinatown. Decent value for a quick stay in Sydney if you don't mind the older style accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresentation”
Reviews.Author: Rose B
Reviews.Content: The hotel's website is very misleading.The only thing this hotel has in it's favour is that it is centrally located. It is run down, not to be confused with it's heritage status, poorly managed, noisy, dirty, and extremely cramped rooms with TV and DVD systems that do not work. Our experience was not a favourable one and we will definitely not be returning, nor recommending, this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick”
Reviews.Author: Srikantha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aaron's in a deluxe room for 9 nights. The room was tidy but also rather dated. This didn't bother us - it was what we expected after reading the other reviews. I think one area for improvement is around housekeeping. I think someone different cleaned our room each day, as each day it was done to a different standard. One day it was fantastically clean, and the next day our glasses had been rinsed but still smelled of juice and there were still crumbs on the floor, and so on. Our towels were changed everyday (although we did not request this). However, most days we had no hand towel and some days we had no bath mat. I think each person tidied and replaced towels to a different standard - this was a little frustrating. Having said all this, I would stay again (with earplugs because the traffic is noisy) - it's a great location and a good price compared to everything else in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Saturday night with 19 friends of variouse ages and every single one of us were very happy with the rooms and awsome breakfast. I highly recomend this place to anyone, it is great value for money and very convienient, just a walk from the harbour and markets and parking is easy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I will always stay at Aarons when I'm in Sydney without a doubt. Thankyou Aarons Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: kemchong
Reviews.Content: The name is Aaron Hotel but is a motel standard. 80% of US$30 motel in the USA is far better than this so-called hotel. The hotel is surrounded by roads on all side and is very noisy throughout the night. Even the alley is very noisy with trucks unloading very early in the morning. Noise from neighboring room can be heard also. Room is very small, old and dirty. I stayed for 10 nights and they don't change the towel unless being told -- put the towel on the floor so that they change it but it ended back hanging to dry in the rack. Linens are not change for my entire stay. Bathroom is dirty, very old and hot water don't flow evenly.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Browny-1888550
Reviews.Content: This place needs to be blown up I wouldn't let my dog stay here Over priced back packers looks like 5 star hotel going to doctors to get checked for STDs

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Charlie B
Reviews.Content: When checking in the key system was out of order, so it was a bad start from there. The room was ridiculously tiny for the rate charged. There was no room even for a little table. The small hallway had a slight step which I kept tripping, felt like suing the hotel if I hurt myself. The bathroom looked like it was an old kitchen, the shower came only to my eye level, as if its only for short people with a cheap looking shower curtain around it, not even a soap dish to place my soap. It was obvious after the first night's stay that the sheets were not changed, the towels were so old they looked like rags, bath mat not replaced & tea/coffee not refilled, I think all the room attendant did was pull up the sheets & empty the bins, nothing else was cleaned, glad my tip was not taken, certainly not deserving a single cent. Of course, the garbage removal around 2am every night by the council was ridiculous, all hotels around the area should protest. Overall, the hotel was only a step up from a backpacker's hostel, very poor value for rate charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Ceejay777
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after an exhaustive search of places to stay in Sydney, as it was only for 2 nights I did not want to spend a fortune. After reading a few reviews on Aarons, I really didn't know what to expect but I must admit, many people who have left negative experiences must have very high expectations as I found this to be a great hotel based on the price ($100 per night including breakfast). The counter staff were overall very helpful in answering my questions (as I had never been to Sydney before, I had to ask them for directions quite a few times and they were always happy to oblige). I found them to be very friendly, engaging in a good chat while they were checking me in, booking my airport bus etc. And they actually knew Sydney (unlike other people I asked over the course of my trip who could have been in bloody Perth and they wouldn't have known the difference). One disappointing point I need to note at this point, when I arrived (11am Friday) I was told I could not access my room until 2pm. I didn't appreciate this a great deal, as I had just come straight from the airport (after a 7am flight from Melbourne) and it also happened to be the wettest day in Sydney's history since 1954. Cue me walking around Sydney (sightseeing, which I had planned to do anyway but the rain may have changed things) in the pouring rain until 2pm! The room was very clean, bathroom & toilet were also very clean (no fan, but no matter) and facilities were what I would expect from a 3 star hotel. Second (and last) disappointing note, the alarm clock speaker did not work. I asked reception to look at it twice, which they said they did but it still didn't make noise. Not comforting when you hate to get up at 4:30am to make a flight! (Wake-up call was made precisely on time though, gold star for that!) Would I stay here again? Absolutely. I am thinking about heading back up to Sydney before the end of the year anyway, so I may just be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good shower, but rubbish compactor noise at midnight. Overall OK.”
Reviews.Author: raras2u
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to Darling Harbour, Central Railway Station n Chinatown. The only problem? Rubbish compactor noise in the middle of the night!! No bathtub but shower mixer was really good.TV, coffee n tea making facilities, n fridge. But no free wi-fi. Probably one of the few that give this hotel a thumbs up despite the noise. Was hesistant after reading the reviews but it turned out to be alright. Maybe our expectation was not high.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again.”
Reviews.Author: DDD099
Reviews.Content: Would not come back here again. The room met expectations in regards to value for price, but failed expectations of decent cleanliness. Everything had stains on them, including the sheets, blankets and mattress protector. The blankets also had hairs all over them, making them very unattractive to sleep with and didn't give peace of mind that they were clean and hygienic. The service offered was standard, there was a booking request that was missed but it was solved by having the room moved which was an acceptable outcome. Other then that the central Sydney location was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can stand the noise”
Reviews.Author: jomira6830
Reviews.Content: Very peculiar hotel.Converted from warehouse on edge of Chinatown Tiny room(double) and very awkward. Weird tack on plastic bathroom.Noise at night very loud from traffic and passers by etc.There was some obscure arrangement for breakfast which we could never fathom out. Lots of places to eat locally.. Very convenient position for travel around the city. Mainline rail, underground, tram and monorail. Visit Paddys market opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, Convenient Location, can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: bubblycanary
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across the Haymarket in Chinatown and very convenient to get around the city. Sydney Exhibition Center & Darling Harbour is just only 10-15 minutes walk from the hotel. Bus stop is a block away and of course restaurants are just about every corner since it's located in the China town area. I booked the Executive room which is in a way a 1-bedroom suite as the living room and the bedroom are separated. Both rooms are spacious which is, I think, a bit uncommon for Sydney hotel rooms. The living room has flat screen tv, small dining table, minibar, and big & comfy couch. The bed is also big and comfortable. The bathroom is very clean. That said, the decor is still pretty dated and the sliding doors in the bedroom & the bathroom should be replaced as they feel as if they're gonna fall out anytime. But overall everything is clean and comfortable. The noise - because the Executive room is located on the top floor (accessible for a flight of stairs only) and there are only a few room on that floor I did not have an trouble with noises coming from the hallway or the nearby rooms. However, street noise can be a problem. The hotel exceeds my expectation and would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible- don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sandybeach135
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel, reception area was ok but once we got into the lift to the room the carpets said it all..... Got to the rooms, very small could now swing a cat in it, carpets were mingin dirty ... En suite toilet....had mould growing on the walls.... Looked more like a toilet u wud see in a prison, and the dirt on the floor tiles was disgusting ... We left this hotel as quick as we arrived.... A health hazard to say the least !!!! I'm all for cheap and cheerful but i like a place to be clean.... THIS PLACE WAS NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute let down!”
Reviews.Author: kimmii82
Reviews.Content: When I organised this accommodation I did it back in Feb 2011, which I was guaranteed two double beds, When I arrived I walked into our room which had two single beds and no door on the shower instead just a shower curtain around the shower. I could not see a toilet either. I feel when I paid $189 for the night this is unsatisfactory! I went to see the manager and she couldn't have given a toss! We were moved to another room only this time there were bunk beds, we were compensated by been given a free breakfast at another motel! We also had to make our own beds. My question is what do the the house keeping do. Citigate motel told me when i went there for breakfast that it would have cost me for the night $130 BIT OF A DIFFERENCE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: ChocWallace
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on this hotel I was a bit scared what we might find but really we were very happy and comfortable. The bed was super comfy the room was clean the bathroom was big enough all in all we were happy with our 3 star hotel. It would have been great if the lift worked so that's my only gripe. Check out the pub next door (Jade Hotel) if you are a kiwi, Tui on tap, yeah, All Black memorabilia everywhere and a great friendly owner. Paddy's Market right across the road walk through these and you are at the Mono Rail and Light Rail stops, awesome way to get in and out of tourist stops for a small charge, Paddy's market has 3 levels so make sure you see it all, huge food court 3 floor. The hotel is right in the middle of Chinatown so you do feel as if you are in another country, was a bit scary to start with. Do try the food out of the small bakery just as you enter into Chinatown under the big frontage part, awesome cakes etc for so small a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: MtrsPacino
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to attend a friend's wedding in Sydney Harbour , as it was in Chinatown we thought it would be a great place to use as a base to explore Sydney. The first night was ok, despite the very very basic and rather tatty room, and we spent the first day exploring Sydney as the room wasn't somewhere we wanted to spend a great deal of time. There was a horrible solid shelf above the head of the bed that we felt was actually dangerous so had to move the bed to a safer location. On the second night my husband went out on the stag night for the wedding and I stayed in the hotel. I paid $10 for internet for the night (24 hours access that I was told would be lost if I shut my laptop down) and settled in to chat to my children at home in the UK. Suddenly the power went off. I sat in total darkness for almost an hour before texting my husband and asking him to return to the hotel. Our room was electrically locked so I was concerned about getting back into it if I went to find out what was going on. On my husband's return it appeared that the reception area had full power whereas we were still in total darkness (with no air con). The staff were appalling, they were rude and clearly didn't care that I had been alone, 10,000 miles from home in complete darkness that was unexplained and clearly unexpected. They even offered to lend me their plug in fan - and as I explained to them, although the reception area was fully powered the rooms were in darkness so the fan wouldn't work. Apparently this was arranged maintenance and we should have had "a note under the door" to tell us about it. (We didn't get this note). The night manager was offensive and rude and abusive. He was clearly in awe of Basil Fawlty but unaware that Mr Fawlty was a made up comedy character. There was nothing comedy about the manager that night at Aarons Hotel. He was generally replusive and rude. They also never turned their router back on and refused to refund me for my 2 hours of internet (I'd paid for 24 hours) as they said it wasn't their issue, it was the internet provider's problem. Having no response whatsoever from the staff we decided to leave the hotel the following morning and made other arrangements. Never ever again would we use this hotel and we would most certainly never recommend it to anybody - not even people we dislike.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Holidaybilly
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews of this hotel I was apprehensive about our visit but to be honest I was very pleasantly surprised. We stayed 4 nights in a deluxe double room. The room was basic but everything was clean and in working order including a/c and fans. The location is excellent, in Chinatown, 5 mins walk to shops, darling harbour, central train station and railway square bus station. Don't bother with breakfast, book room only as there are plenty of great cafes for brekkie in Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “value priced hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: PerthTrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at aarons last year. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room although small was clean and serviced daily. The location is ideal for shopping as it is across the road from Paddy's Market. Being on the edge of Chinatown there are plenty of restaurants and food outlets. Darling Harbour is within walking distance. I intend to stay here again later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy-got no sleep”
Reviews.Author: Tigerace
Reviews.Content: I've never been too worried about the appearance of rooms and bathrooms as long as their functional. Our hotel room was okay, apart from a few steep steps into the bathroom and entrance door which we did trip over a few times, so be careful. The problem I did have with the hotel was the noise factor. Our room was right on one of the side streets (Thomas lane?) where the large restaurants in china town had the rear of their kitchens. On average, 4 noisy trucks per night would come and collect rubbish a night. The room had no sound proofing at all, and you mind as well have been sleeping outside at an airport. One rubbish truck would come at 11pm, one at 1am, another at about 3 am and then a final one at about 5am. On the second day we asked to be moved, but the hotel staff weren't very helpful and said they had no other rooms available. We had already paid for the hotel in advance. Also note I found the bed very hard and that they don't serve breakfast at the hotel anymore. You can get vouchers for a nearby restaurant for breakfast, but it doesn't open until 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Central location.”
Reviews.Author: fussy_traveller_oz
Reviews.Content: Booked a room in this hotel because it was difficult to find a decent room for 4 people in central Sydney. Apparently this family room (6 people) was one the bigger sized rooms, with a saggy queen bed and a pair of bunk beds. Hate to think what a standard room is like. Room was outdated and especially the bathroom, which was also a bit smelly. TV, fridge and coffee making facilities available. Central location is fantastic, and staff were friendly enough. Definitely not upmarket, don't expect great things. Would only recommend for a short stay or if looking for a central location at a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again, and would not recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Rose_7711
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend away with my partner, big mistake there was absolutely nothing good about this hotel. Reception staff was very unfriendly and rude. Rooms were dirty, found black hair on sheets and the room were extremely smelly. Room were of bad quality, complained to reception about size and condition of room and the receptionist answered me back saying â€˜we are a heritage listed building, there is not much I can doâ€� Rates were high and you donâ€™t get value for your money. Would never stay here again, and would not recommend anyone else to do so...

Reviews.Title: “great! nooooooooooooooot!”
Reviews.Author: hayster10
Reviews.Content: well.... where would i like to begin?!?!?!? if you like to stay in small, no room, green bathrooms, no window to open, bars on windows, hair found in all my bedding, dirty carpets, scary lift, loud noise due to bar underneath, no cutlery, no coffee/tea facilities, the view of crumby buildings and china town alleys, uncomfortable and dingy then this is the place for you. the only thing it had going for it was close to central station, paddys markets, china town and cheap internet for $1.00 for 15 mins. The staff were ok but not considerably helpfull. We stayed 2 nights and after walking in after the first 10 mins we were very appalled but had to deal with it because of time restraint. I wasnt to keen that the recommended restuarant/cafe of the hotel was away from the location of this place. I would not recommend for familes or large groups as it is not worth the $$$$ for the standard given. Ok for 1 or 2 people; short stay. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: cruze10
Reviews.Content: rooms are very small, and uncomfortable. no room to eat in with kids. very noisy at night. bathroom needs major reno. had to ask for our room to be serviced on one morning and ask for more soap and toilet paper. great location. opposite paddy's markets and close to chinatown, but way too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT what i expected one night stay= disasterous situation”
Reviews.Author: unhappy57
Reviews.Content: I have just recently stayed a night at Aarons Hotel in Sydney. I stayed the night at the hotel with 8 other class mates as we were on an school excursion. We arrived and went up to our rooms to unpack our bags and get changed to go down town and go shopping. When we walked into our room straight away we were confronted with the ghastly smell of urine. Then i was dissapointed after a big day of travelling to see that we had to make our own beds. Myself and my classmates all got into the elevator and to our surprise the elevator just stopped and we felt it fall. WE WERE STUCK IN THE ELEVATOR. Luckily enough one of the teachers who accompanyed us on the excursion decided to take the stairs so we rang him and told him to notify the reception as there was NO phone in the elevator for emergencies. Finally after 45 minutes we were let free and able to breathe again. There were 11 of us all together in the elevator as we picked up a few other people on our level. We all walked out into the reception and were confronted with the most rudest and disrespectful receptionists as they were laughing at us it was not a laughing matter!.We were not at all given an apology or compensated for the situation. I recommend that no one should stay here unless they are looking for slap happy accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid staying here by all means.”
Reviews.Author: lloyd255100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really bad, room looks depressing. We booked it for 6 nights, but realised our mistake as soon as we entered our room. We left our luggage, found internet cafe and booked another hotel from the next day, only stayed one night in this place. This hotel used to storeroom and it really shows. That was the only time we couldn't stya in place we originally booked and had to change our accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for three nights, stayed for one...”
Reviews.Author: billyalabama
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it quick. After it was suggested in a travel book, we reserved a few nights @ Aaron's Hotel before departing on our trip. As was mentioned earlier, the location is very central downtown- very convenient. However, when we got there and it was a bit underwhelming. The rooms are modest, but doable. We got hung up on the fact that when we checked into our room, we were immediately greeted by a number of particularly energetic roaches in the restroom/shower area. We notified the front desk, which didn't seem to see what the big deal was. The female at the front desk then proceeded to lecture me that roaches of that nature were common in that region of the world. I nodded, reminding her that roaches can be found in practically every region of the world, but as a rule of thumb, I don't pay to share a room with them. Anyway, we asked to simply get a refund, which was promptly denied. I will say that I was amazed at the swift, practiced manner with which the female desk attendant denied us our refund. Based on her cheekiness, I'd say that she has to do so daily. I was well aware of the refund policy, so I didn't need to hear her 10 minute diatribe on the finer points of what "no refund" means. (SIDE NOTE: Though, my thought was that "no refund" was applicable to late cancellations, not customer dissatisfaction with a valid concern.) The desk did offer to upgrade us to another room, which we accepted. There were no roaches, but we opted to stay only the night, cut our losses, and stay somewhere a bit nicer (albeit more expensive). All in all, I'd rather not pay that much money for bugs when I can pay a $30 more per night and be in a genuinely nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BRING SHOWER SHOES!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirloka
Reviews.Content: Ok, well........I'll start this on a good note. 1. The location is awesome. Its right next to the Paddy Markets, which is heaven if your looking for souveniors. 2. Within walking distance to the Darling Harbour and the train station. Ok thats it for the good. The bad would be 1. They seriously need to update there website. I mean come on now. People are going to figure it out ASAP that they got got once they get inside this place. 2. I was slightly horrified when I looked into the shower. It is definitely not something you would want to put your bare feet on. Trust me on this one. Ive been to countries were the shower is water bottles and the bathroom is a hole in the ground. This is unexceptable. I paid 70+ dollars a night and this is what I get? I went to the YHA around the corner and was suprised at the same I couldve gotten for 30 bucks. 3. The noise. It was nonstop music and yelling and my room and clothes smelled like fish and duck from the food places right underneath. The trash trucks are no joke. They run ALL night long. I really wanted to like this place. The cleaning staff was very friendly. Cant really say the same for the people at the counter. It seemed as if you were bothering them everytime you asked for something. I will never come back to this place unless it was deeply discounted. I felt pangs of longing everytime I passed the Holiday Inn right across from the McDonalds. If people do come to this place I would say its best for one or two nights. I was here for longer and my theory is, if you can afford to go to Australia for longer than 2 days then you can afford to stay somewhere a little nicer than here. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “noisy but central”
Reviews.Author: erinkarratha
Reviews.Content: it is great being able to access the centre of the city but the lodging was noisy and the windows rattled in the wind. the hotel is obviously a bit tired as the first impression is of the counter being worn and old. the rooms were clean. just the noise of people returning to their rooms in the halls was annoying

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, loud, and not for the claustrophobic; location only average.”
Reviews.Author: ramlion11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for 3 nights on our honeymoon. We had a standard room with double bed and ensuite bathroom. Where to even begin... When booking, location seemed like it was great (never been to Sydney before), and the price was obviously very good for the location. Well, the location was okay, and price was very good when disregarding all other qualities of hotels in Sydney. And that's about it for the positives. 1) The room was tiny, slate gray concrete walls, high ceilings, and two windows facing a narrow alley. Sound a bit institutional? Well, the building was originally built for cold storage for an area market, and the rooms don't look too far removed from that. The pictures on their website DO NOT do justice to the way the room actually looks. Believe me. I compared after check-in. 2) The bathroom is even tinier. You literally have to sit at an angle on the toilet because there is no room for your knees as the sink/cabinet is in the way. 3) The room was filthy. I found a roach on the wall of the shower upon first entering and looking around after check-in. There were "adult hairs" all along the base of the walls and corners in the bathroom. There was a nasty layer of dust (?) under the pillows on the bed against the wall. Cigarette burns on the carpet. Now before the manager responds here and says I should have informed the front desk... I DID inform the front desk the next morning. (We arrived the previous evening and had no desire to have to clear out of the room for them to re-clean after first arrival.) They assured me they would re-clean the room. Well, when we returned, the room had been turned over. But first thing I did was check the walls and corners of the bathroom. Same disgusting state as before. 4) Building certainly does not feel secure. Front door was never locked while we were there, and nobody was at reception (and we entered late a couple of nights; reception is staffed 24 hours, but there is a staff room around the corner from the desk which does not have view of the door). Stairs next to the elevator is always unlocked, and each floor off it is unlocked. No keyhole on door. And no deadbolt; only the electronic lock. 5) Room was VERY loud. As I said above, our room was on an alley. About 4 in the morning or so, we were awoken by trucks in the alley (delivering or picking up from businesses on the alley I would assume), and this continued occasionally along with a loud garbage truck up until our alarm went off at 7:00am. 6) Location is fine, but not great. We certainly did not spend any time directly near the hotel. Lots of tourist spots and good neighborhoods within long walking distance, but Sydney, perhaps more than any other city I've been to, is flooded with hotels in every neighborhood. (I'm guessing it is because of the old British law that only hotels could serve alcohol?) Point is, location should not be the primary selling point for this place. I think that's about it; my feelings are probably pretty clear. Unfortunately, this place left a bad taste in our mouth for Sydney, which really is a beautiful and fun city. The price was undoubtedly good, but I have no doubt someone could find a much better place without going too dramatically higher. This place should be classified as an expensive backpacker, nothing more. It is not a nice western hotel in anything but name.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great price, awsome room service”
Reviews.Author: Minal11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during my holiday in Sydney and it was wonderful! close to everything you could want, so many food choices and markets/stores around you. Barely need to walk far for anything. The hotel is extremely well priced for its location, the room was clean and the room service was amazing. Will definately be staying here again on my holiday. Didn't hear any noise from the bar/road that people complained about, was quiet and comfy. Thank you for making our holiday a special one, all the staff were very helpful. Recommended to all our friends

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, dirty rooms and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cmlglass
Reviews.Content: On arrival I was informed that I would be unable to check into my room early even though I had had this matter confirmed previously at the time of booking. This meant a four hour wait after my very long flight from Scotland. The receptionist was most unhelpful. During my week long stay I think the was cleaned once, if that. The room was grubby and shabby with missing light bulbs and even missing lamp shade which proved quite dangerous with the heat of the lightbulb. The hotel was very noisy and we were kept awake every night with very loud banging from the floor above. I phoned reception several time which was a fruitless exercise as the noise continued. The hotel's only good feature was it's location. It is walking distance to darling harbour and the train station. I would definitely not recommend this hotel. I have stayed in far better youth hostels which are cleaner, friendlier and cheaper so save yourself any hassle and choose somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: leeGosford
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly & efficient, all the staff were wonderful & nothing was too much trouble. The location was excellent , the room was neat & comfortable, we liked the ambience of the area, busy without being too noisy, we would love to stay there again when we are in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: Moochy07
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel, only a 5 minute down to the restaurants and bars at darling harbour. The staff had really good local knowledge and were really willing to help with any questions we had. Rooms are pretty basic but are quite clean and comfortable. Family rooms can fit 6 people so great when traveling with friends as we could all stay in the same room and a cheap price. We'll definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations that didn't break the bank”
Reviews.Author: aussieatheart78
Reviews.Content: I really liked this quaint hotel. It reminded me of a single dorm room. I appreciated the sink and toilet being separate from the shower area. Ceiling fans, closet space, mini fridge, nice tv, and desk Very comfortable. I didn't spend much time there, but the time I did was nice. Only bad thing was that the renovating business next door kept causing power surges. Nonetheless, my food never spoiled and the staff was nice enough to heat up food for me. I'm vegan, so eating out can be challenging at times. When I go back to SYD, I look forward to staying here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: sus86london
Reviews.Content: For a start I would like to say that the hotel write up that I read before booking is mostly fiction as when we arrived we could barely see the similarities. The rooms were very small in comparison to pictures that we had seen. They were also shabby & very out-of-date and could have done with a complete renovation. The toilet & shower room were actually a good size but not particularly clean. The air-con unit in our room didn't work properly. The curtains were so thin that they didn't shut out the street lights which made it hard to sleep once the sun had risen early in the mornings. I would say the best qualities of this hotel are its location as it was only a short walk away from Darling Harbour and the city centre and also that it was fairly cheap. In my opinion it is still over priced for what you get! If you're only staying for a few days, aren't too bothered about the cleanlines & won't be spending a lot of time in the hotel then it may be suitable but I would certainly not recommend this hotel to friends or family!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel? more like ROACH MOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: musicfiend419
Reviews.Content: I get in the room and it lLOOKS decent, set my luggage on the ground and use the restroom. I come out the restroom to find a HUGE cockroach on my luggage! i hit it off and move my luggage to the bed and go downstairs to complain. All they tell me is sorry I told them i wanted to check back out. They said they could offer to move me the NEXT night to another room but there were no other rooms available this night. i told them i was checking immediately out and i wanted a refund. I even offered to pay for the first night but i wanted a refund for the second night. They told me to call back in the morning to have expedia talk to the manager. i go back up to get my stuff to find another roach on the ground! I called the hotel to check first and i was told that they would refund the second night. GREAT! so i call expedia to process the refund and to call the hotel. Expedia called the hotel and talks to the manager MELODY and she tells expedia that they will NOT refund anything because i did not cancel 48 hrs ahead of time. i then call the hotel back to discuss why i as told that i would get a refund for the second night. they said "sorry, not sure why you were told that"..then i asked why should i pay 2 nights for a hotel i did not stay at which had roaches? i was told that it's COMMON to have roaches! what?! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great night sleep before 26 hours of traveling with PLENTY of room for all!”
Reviews.Author: EllenNYS
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and had spent three weeks in Australia which equals 5 large suitcases, 5 carry on, plus some bags. The room was equal to two rooms in size, (totally unbelievable for an inner city hotel). There were two sets of bunk beds and a Queen, which seemed more like an American King. Our bed was the most comfortable we had experienced in Australia; all the kids (ages 18,17, and 15) said they were comfortable as well. There was plenty of room for suitcases and more. There was a refrigerator with chilled water and glasses waiting our arrival as well as creamers for coffee, and candy on our pillows. The bathroom was normal. The staff was excellent! There was internet in the lobby for a dollar for 15 mins. or you could pay slightly more and have it in your room. For 30 cents you can print a page. Parking was down a long block, in a parking ramp. Guests of Aarons get a discount. The cost was $24.00 single entry only. You have to get a voucher from the hotel or it is $50.00. No one told us this information and that cost my husband two trips to the parking lot, when we were attempting to go to the airport- stress. He was also provided misinformation regarding the parking when he went back to get the voucher. Providing accurate information and informing guests of the parking rules, they can improve on. The city tram has a station just around the corner as well. We thought it was GREAT and would stay there if we go back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation for Bucks Show”
Reviews.Author: ShereeSmith
Reviews.Content: I organised group accomodation at Aaron's Hotel for 21 guys for a Bucks Show. We had a few communication difficulties, mainly slow emails, nothing to problematic or not easily fixed. The boys arrived with a smooth check-in, accomodation was good, keeping in mind the price of $45 per night in central Sydney!, rooms were clean, bedding comfortable and overall they had an enjoyable stay. I would recommend Aaron's hotel for group bookings for the price of accomodation, location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Top location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SimonJHarris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aarons for just over a week and it was an ideal base to explore the city from, with Darling Harbour just a stones throw away. I found the staff super helpful, warm and friendly. My room was cleaned everyday and whilst not 5 star, was large and excellent value for money. The HD TV was a bonus for when I was too jet lagged to venture out into the city. In my opinion Aarons is a great budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central and a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Niss99
Reviews.Content: I found Aarons Hotel central to transport and shopping. The staff were friendly and always willing to help and give advice. The room was clean, and although in a reasonably busy area very quiet. Good value for money. I will stay at Aarons Hotel when I'm next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: violin1
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on this place I was a little unsure when I made the booking for my daughter and myself for a short break in Sydney. I need not have been. It is a really great Budget Hotel. Clean rooms, comfy beds, phone, air-con, ceiling fan, little fridge, nice big TV, tea and coffe stuff, ensuite with what you need, PAYG wireless internet and terminals, heaps of tourist info brochures and very nice helpfull reception staff. For a good value sight seeing trip to Sydney it is perfect. Very friendly reception staff, gave us a free upgrade from a Deluxe Twin to a Family Room!! A few minutes walk to Central station, two mins walk to the monorail, famous market just across the road. I am going there again with my wife later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “shame on aaron.”
Reviews.Author: ellisya
Reviews.Content: smelt like someone smoked a bong in my room. It was repolsive.the rooms are very dirty including old food left on carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean as a 4 1/2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tammie_1965
Reviews.Content: As an Executive House keeper of a 4 1/2 star hotel. This hotel has very high standards of cleanliness. The room was comfortable with a TV that is massive. I would recommend this hotel to a friend and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but poor room quality”
Reviews.Author: AmberTaipei
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, easy access to central station, China town, haymarket and Darling Horbour. However, the room is small and smelly. It's just a budget hotel. Very noisy in the morning but okay at night. Don't expect too much from this hotel for the money you pay. Some staff very friendly and helpful and others are not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room not as described.”
Reviews.Author: WildTurkey111
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend and though I was mainly booking here for the location (close to everything we wanted for the weekend) the room itself was disappointing. We booked and paid for a deluxe room (meant to have more room than a standard) but our particular room was half taken up by the stairwell and the elevator (which creaked every time it went up or down) so the actual living/bed area was tiny. The bathroom was small also with not a lot of room to move (two people could not stand in there at the same time to brush our teeth etc). The windows needed to be thicker as I was woken by the smallest of noises outside on the street at night. Maybe next time (if there is a next time) we will not be in this particular room so will not have an elevator and stairwell taking up space, but in any case we should not have paid for a deluxe room when I know that other (deluxe) rooms were twice this size. On a plus note - Staff were very friendly, the rooms were very clean and the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kinothai
Reviews.Content: Considering the lodging rates in Sydney this property offers a real good deal! It is of course not the Four Seasons, but the staff is very friendly and helpful, the room is basic (very basic ...) but clean and the city center is not so far away. Very close to the central railway station, with very good pubblic transport connections. The breakfast served in the cafÃ¨ Jade is rich and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: dreamer5869
Reviews.Content: Would probably stay again but in a deluxe room if just for the size.The family room was quite small and the a/c was right on top of my daughters head making it quite cold for her though it was a warm night. The carpets need replacing and the bathroom is like a camping shower, very small. The bed is so low you feel like your sleeping on the ground, although we found the mattress quite comfortable.Couldn't ask for a better location. The staff were great, they even let you leave your luggage after you book out so you dont have to drag it all over the city while you sight see!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic accommodation with magic location”
Reviews.Author: cleo064
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a few days visit with our grandchildren - best location, rooms quite suitable, staff very friendly and helpful, whilst certainly not luxury standard, the hotel provides what is needed for the cost, but our main positive is the availability for 5 or 6 family members to stay there in the same room , as it seems every other motel/hotel in Sydneythinks all families are just 4 people, so thank you Aarons - we'll definately go back there. Sandra and family, Brisbane

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: OldWiseDude
Reviews.Content: Aarons Hotel in Sydney is a charming older building that is comfortable and practical. I was met by staff that were friendly, helpful and professional. Although it's not on one of the major, well known roads, it is easy enough to find and central Sydney attractions (CBD, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Chinatown) are within short distances. Don't expect "shiny stainless steel everything and big windows" like the typical metal and glass monstrosities, but the room I stayed in was neat, clean and well appointed and had a character the newer places will never have. Loved it, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Safe,friendly,HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BrunoTweedHeads
Reviews.Content: As a lone traveler I felt very safe in hotel,comfortable 1st floor room little noise even room face main street. rooms are serviced each day although I had to ask for floor to be vaccumed,but overall very clean. If you don't want luxery,but convenience and comfort, can I suggest this is the place close to theatres,tranport and attractions.I will be back B.M Tweed Heads

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, perfectly-located hotel for a very low price”
Reviews.Author: Erasmus66
Reviews.Content: Since retiring I have stopped staying in up-market hotels and on a recent trip to Sydney decided to give Aarons a go. It is so cheap, particularly when it is located so close to so many attractions (opposite Paddy's Markets, five minutes walk from Darling Harbour and within minutes of all public transport) that I was a bit concerned that I might finish up sleeping in a broom-cupboard! I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room - not big by any means, but certainly sufficient for a lone traveller or couple - and the comfort of the bed. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and the place had a nice "feel" about it. I would thoroughly recommend it to budget travellers, in fact to anybody who is looking for something that's very economical and right in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay .”
Reviews.Author: Bezzle
Reviews.Content: I stay at Aarons every year with a group of women shoppers. We always have a no worries easy stay at Aarons. It is pleasant AND clean. The breakfast was scumptous. The staff are very obliging , and friendly. The location is excellent, for shopping and going out. W We will be back next year. Cheers Cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gogs11uk
Reviews.Content: For this supposedly being a 3 star hotel, it must have been a blind assessor that did this place. The rooms we were allocated appeared to be a covered over and blocked in balcony with rattling windows, crumby on-suites that left a lot to be desired and some of the most ignorant staff I have ever had the displeasure to meet. Don't get me wrong, there were one or two who were very helpful but when we complained about the rooms we were in, it fell on deaf ears. No offer of an exchange. I complained to my travel agent on my return and still waiting for them to sort something out. Not family friendly as my 15 year old son was not allowed into the bar beside the hotel and had to order his fod in the hotel foyer. we then had the option of eating at the chairs outside the hotel on a busy road or in the games room downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Study Abroad”
Reviews.Author: MegaM7
Reviews.Content: i'm not really enjoyed the hotel because i prefer to go out than just stay at the hotel. So the hotel just for slept for i think 3-4 hour. The hotel is good but not luxurious. The place of that hotel is good because near the Market City and it's a strategic location. I like that hotel and i think it's not too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience===Rip-Off Price For Room Offered”
Reviews.Author: ROLANDRATCheshire
Reviews.Content: To potential clients.If you are offered rom 228 FLEE! If you are offered bunk beds FLEE! My friend and I suffered a nightmare visit on 3rd.Oct. Room 228 is abroom cupboard that barely qualifies as a single room.The bunk beds are metal monstrosities that creak,shake,rattle and roll with every bodily movement. In our 3 week stay in Oz. visiting several cities this was by far the worst experience and. believe it or not, by far the most expensive. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, good clean value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: CessnockUnited
Reviews.Content: The last 5 years I've organised a Football / Race weekend for 20 fellow workers,we travel 4 hours to Sydney to let our hair down and have a great time.The hotel caters for all travellers , large or small groups , the rooms we consistently booked were bedding 5 men and all were of large size with A/C and quality bathrooms. Every person could get their own door key card , which made things very easy when coming back to the hotel at different times and maintain security not having to leave the door unlocked when in bed.Location of the hotel is its biggest assest being 30 metres from Paddy's Market and a 5 minute walk to Central Railway Station. Cental China town is 100 metres down the road along with the Light Rail stop. As value for money goes This is a Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: mikendomsmum
Reviews.Content: There were 8 of us, two families of 4 with 3 teenagers and 1 pre-teen. We booked two large rooms at Aaron's in Sydney. The location is good, right near China Town and the Darling Harbor. We got a big room with 4 beds, one queen, one set of bunks and one single. It was very comfortable and we had no problems. The front desk service was great, helpful and cheery. They directed us to a wonderful restaurant with reasonable prices for a family. Our friends got a two room suite, one room with a large bed and one room with two singles. They were very pleased with it. The bathrooms were a bit strange, they were all one plastic unit such as you'd expect on a train or ship. Since every thing in the bathroom worked, we didn't much care. All in all, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Very clean, great location, affordable near lots of restaurants and shopping and friendly service. The difficulty in Sydney is that they usually only allow 3 to a regular hotel room so for a family of 4 you'd need two rooms and at over $200 a night per room in a basic level hotel, that gets too pricey. There are computers for use in the lobby for less than $5 per hour, I think it was $3au. They do have breakfast service right off the lobby, we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “It's like a bad dream”
Reviews.Author: baddream1
Reviews.Content: Dated interior, hot noisy room, it's like a bad dream which you have to pay for. I wouildn't stay there again if the room were given to me free!

Reviews.Title: “Very good basic level accomodation”
Reviews.Author: thelightshadchanged
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Sydney looking for a room the same night, before possibly the busiest weekend of the year - Australia Day weekend. Enquired at one of the tourist information offices who managed to find a double room in this place for me for a reasonable price, so booked without knowing what to expect. Found just what I was looking for. Overall impression - basic, pleasant environment to stay, courteous & friendly staff, room adequately equipped with TV, separate shower and toilet room. Large fan above the bed - much needed when it's 40 degrees outside! Only there for a night but hotel appeared to offer deals on tours of surrounding area with local tour company, would have taken these up if I'd been there a day or two longer! Option of getting breakfast for around $10 in the morning- took this, served in separate room between hotel & adjoining restaurant, nice food brought promptly. Would stay here again if ever in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Walked out”
Reviews.Author: NettyEA
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the brochure or website pictures! The hotel has since admitted that "newly renovated" advertised in both has not happened and has been postponed until end of 2009. Although we and some friends booked 2 deluxe rooms, the ones we were given certainly were not. The rooms were smelly, dirty and hardly a 3* (as advertised). There was a large hole in the bathroom wall, no plug, the shower door was broken and the shower was completely mouldy. The bottom of the wardrobe was broken, the bedspread had a large rip and several other holes had been mended. The sheets - although freshly laundered still had stains on them! The curtain barely covered the window - which you could not see out of due to the air conditioning unit which sat in front of it and looked like it had been installed for 30 years. The walls were also just painted brick! We immediately went back to reception and asked for our money back. The receptionist (maybe duty manager?) was rude and just said that they would keep 2 nights of our money and when we complained that it wasn't a 3* hotel she barked that it was BUDGET. This is nothing more than a 1* hotel at best. We walked around the corner to the Holiday Inn where, for less money, we had large, clean, fantastic rooms. We are currently complaining to the Office of Fair Trading for NSW, as the hotel has still kept one nights money and offered a discount next time we stay at the hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Love_n_Serenity
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for one night only and we would never stay there again. The room we weâ€™re allocated was in the corner of level 2. The room was very dusty and smelt like it had not been aired and thoroughly vacuumed for years. Iâ€™m sure there was so much dust in the carpet because I woke at about 4am in the morning and felt I had just swallowed a mouth full of dust. I felt I was being chocked. This is a terrible feeling, to feel you are being suffocated in a small room with no where to go. Iâ€™m so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “nyeee...too loud”
Reviews.Author: Iban-Torontonian
Reviews.Content: we stayed at family room deluxe: bunk bed, twin bed, double bed Floor dirty, Shower was loud, you can see the water heater, we asked for the room NOT facing ultimo rd., we booked in advanced, (you could do this), but no we got teh SECOND floor, facing the racing street ......side of hotel. I didn't believe the other reviewers, but TRUST me, for those who does have a good review of hotel, they must have slept facing the other QUIET side of hotel. Service was good, no worries, fridge big enough, WE ATE in PAddy's Market, YUM YUM, CHEAP CHEAP, front desk was good

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory given the cheap price”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: Some of the more negative reviews are unfair given the cheap accommodation this hotel offers in a prized location close to Sydney Terminal (Central) railway station. Yes, our room was poky. Yes, we could really only get onto the double bed from one side. However, we slept well and there were no noise problems. Being midweek, the hotel did not appear to be full.
