The staff were fine. For A$84, good value but of course those who wish three and a half stars or above need to pay more at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value If You Are Not Looking for Fancy”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to go to Sydney. I got a very good last minute deal that I had to jump on. With no time to plan very well, I found an Australian based website for hotel accommodations. I found the Aaron hotel and used a website based map to make sure it was in the central area of Sydney. The advantages of the hotel are: 1. Price- I paid about $89 for the night and most hotels were charging between $140 to almost $300. 2. Location- It was in a perfect spot. The central train station for Sydney was around the block and about two blocks away. The Darling Harbour tourist entertainment area was about a 15 minute casual walk away. It was very close to Chinatown, so I got a cultural immersion experience that I did not expect. The tour buses for the city were less than two blocks away. The hotel is very basic, I mean very basic. If you are looking for special service and facilities, stay elsewhere. The room was small and a little cramp, but since I was traveling solo that was fine by me. The staff was very friendly and really made effort to get me at room (after a 14 hour flight) much earlier than normal check-in. The facilities were old, but quite adequate. I was not planning to live in the room. There was a restaurant, but with all of the eating that was so close by, I never even tried to use the restaurant. Also there are a lot of hostels in the area, so I saved money for me to pay for my meals at those cafeterias instead. My next two nights were spent at a fancy Marriott (burning points that I'd saved up). However, I have absolutely no problem staying at the Aaron again. I thought it was a very great value for the things that I got. Remember, it is basic, but it is clean and safe. I took one snapshot of the room and it is attached to this review. Oh by the way, I loved Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Are we in the 1970's?”
Reviews.Author: Angie_Hoff
Reviews.Content: What can I say about aaron's hotel...? When we tried to check in, the reception staff couldn't find our booking and didn't seem to understand English too well, we repeated our booking name several times until someone more senior came in and saved the day.... ...On the plus side the room was ready early for us, we were supposed to be checking in at 2pm but thankfully could check in earlier at 12 instead. The room itself had a stale smell of damp and the curtain's wouldn't open properly so we couldn't get any proper day light...the decor wasn't really up to much, they had painted the block wall with 'fashionable' colours to try and make it a bit more trendy... ...the bathroom was like walking into a time machine, was really dated and old, it was like going back into the 70's and the shower was just a mere trickle which was quite difficult to shower in. Basically, it was a liveable place for a couple of nights but your really paying for location more than anything else...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aarons Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: HiSFtraveller69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aarons Hotel Sydney for Sydney Mardi Gras 2008. The hotel was clean, the staff very nice, and the price was nice. The hotel was close to most attractions and perfectly located in Chinatown (by Paddy's Market). It did have a hostel look and feel to it, so if you prefer the major hotel chain feel, then book else where. But for the budget travel, this hotel is highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably rude service”
Reviews.Author: streetsleeper
Reviews.Content: I ticked the excellent box to get your attention. If you have ever stayed at Aarons, you know I'm clearly joking. If there was a zero-star option, I would have chosen that. Having booked a twin room, with two roll-away beds, we arrived to find that they had booked us in a TINY room, barely enough space to open the door and walk inside, and no room even to sleep on the floor. Once we informed the staff that we had been given a 100% assurance that two roll-away beds could be accommodated in the room, we decided to seek alternative accommodation, as there were no rooms left in the hotel. Clearly, as the hotel staff had stuffed up our booking we assumed there would be a hassle-free refund forthcoming. To my utter disbelief and disgust, the staff rudely told us that as we were cancelling our booking, we would not be receiving a refund. This despite the fact that they had mucked up our booking and it was through no fault of our own that we were no longer able to stay at the "hotel". While this was going on, there was a domestic fight two stories up which was clearly audible in the ground floor reception, with the words "don't touch me!" repeated many times. We raised this with staff in case they wanted to inform the local police. They replied that if they called the police about every domestic at the hotel that the police might as well live there permanently. I don''t think they were joking .... While we were disputing our bill, the manager informed us (rudely) that unless another guest came and booked the room we were going to be in, then there would be no refund. Thankfully, an elderly gentleman arrived at just this moment and took our room, much to the pleasure of the greedy manager, who was clearly only concerned with the bottom line. It is unbelievable they were trying to con us out of our money when the hotel was at 100% occupancy. Now onto the hotel room, which we inspected before we left ... After spending about five minutes in the lift while it took us up one floor, I have never seen a smaller, more cramped, dirty, and generally depressing room. After noticing some suspicious stains on the bed linen, we were assured that this was the pattern on the linen, and that the sheets would be replaced at the end of our stay. I have stayed in the Sydney Central YHA (which is approximately the same price), and found it to be clean, modern, attractive, and with enormous airy bathrooms. At Aarons, one almost has to get in the shower before one is able to close the bathroom door, as the bathroom is tiny (and mouldy). I would recommend this room to anyone who is booking the room for a friend and wants to play a mean practical joke on them. Sure, the room is dirt cheap (with the emphasis on dirt), but for the same money you are able to stay at Sydney Central YHA which is closer to the train station and will actually contribute to an enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we bargained for.”
Reviews.Author: Chair_uk
Reviews.Content: We arrived circa 6pm weary from our travels and looking forward to relaxing in our room and taking a shower. Having checked in we went to our room and experienced difficulty in squeezing ourselves and a suitcase into a surprisingly small area, most of which was occupied by a small â€œdouble bedâ€�. Matters were not helped by the unpleasant odour that pervaded the room. Initial impressions hovered between disappointment and disbelief. Further examination of the room revealed tired decor, a curtain partially detached from the curtain rail, the room door security catch broken and non functional and ill fitting sash windows which allowed a draught from the cold Sydney evening to enter immediately above the bed. We had problems finding the â€œen suiteâ€� bathroom but discovered it when we opened a sliding door assuming it to be a wardrobe. Indeed it revealed an area no bigger than a small wardrobe into which had been inserted a moulded plastic unit containing a shower, miniature wash hand basin and a toilet. Doubtless the achievement of cramming so many bathroom facilities into such a small space has been enshrined in the Guinness Book of Records. However, as a bathroom it was effectively non functional but at least we had discovered the source of the unpleasant odour! Whilst we were still coming to terms with our fate, there was a loud sound of banging, shouting and screaming coming from outside our room. Upon investigation we found we found a number of adults running up and down the corridor firing fire extinguishers at one another. We went down to Reception to report the incident and to express our total dissatisfaction with our room. We were met with an unsympathetic blank stare and not a word was spoken to us in response! From here we went out for a meal where we decided the only option open to us was to seek accommodation at the Holiday Inn, a mere five minute walk away. We secured a room for four nights starting the following day. The room which proved excellent in every way cost a mere $19 a night more than the$130 a night charged for Aarons. Returning from meal, we had to navigate our way through a number of people sitting on the hotel steps eating food from paper wrappers. This was mentioned to the desk staff who again gave us their well practiced blank stare. We informed them that we considered the Hotel to be well below itsâ€™ three star rating and that we would be checking out in the morning â€“ again the blank stare. When we checked out we were informed that no part of the $530, paid in advance via a Brisbane Travel Agent for the next four nights, was refundable. If we wished to dispute this we had to get our Travel Agent to fight our corner. Well, at least they spoke to us this time! Not surprisingly, we didnâ€™t get any part of the $530 refunded- an expensive price to pay for a misplaced trust in star ratings and being made to feel unwelcome, insecure, uncomfortable and very unhappy. On the bright side, our short stay in Sydney proved to be most enjoyable once we had the use of the excellent facilities of the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central but gloomy and depressing”
Reviews.Author: MMON
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel in Sydney that came up on airmiles - clean and central but the whole place very gloomy and depressing. We were a family of four (two adults and ten year old twin boys) had a room with two bunkbeds and a double, very noisy aircon, couldn't open the windows, everything brown. My kids aren't fussy but said it was creepy. But clean and everything we needed and as it was on airmiles it didn't cost us - but wouldn't book here again if I was paying, would rather pay more for a bit more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but no windows ?!”
Reviews.Author: Donny1710
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not that impressive: The nicest thing about it was the central location close to the central station, the Haymarket, and the Chinese part of Sidney. The service at the reception was okay, but the hotel interior was completely worn down and seemed more like an institution than a hotel. Our double room was tiny and had no windows. The air condition made a lot of noise and so did the other guests when they passed in the hallway. We couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: amymaree
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place that would sleep 6 for a girls night away. This was by far the cheapest and suited us fine. It is a very plain room - though we stayed in the more expensive option. 2 bunk beds, a double bed, a little table with 4 chairs, a TV, tabletop and a small bathroom. The location was great, right near paddy's, and McDonalds for the morning-after breakfast. It was a walk or a cheap taxi to get out in the night. For a cheap really basic room that fits up to 6 it is a good place. My only negative is the traffic and people in the corridor are quite loud, but this didn't upset me as I knew how much I had paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for 6 people”
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL68
Reviews.Content: Just want to let you know I have a wonderful family and especially my mother and my father who organised this trip for my birthday to Sydney and we stayed at the Aarons Hotel. I would like to say thank you to them as they are very special to me and I love them both dearly and oh lets not forget how much I loved the Flemington Markets. Now here is my opinion, I would recommend the hotel for anyone that has up to 6 people as price wise we found it great for our budget. Also this was the only hotel that would take 6 people in one room other hotels you can only book 2 people therefore we would have had to reserve 4 rooms which is too expensive. We only spent 2 nights at this hotel. I found it to be good but on the last night the hotel seemed to have a large booking of people and about midnight around 20 people filled the next door room and they were banging the walls, throwing the chairs and carrying on. I had to get out of bed and tell them to be quite, I could not contact reception as the number was engaged the whole time. My only advice to the hotel is that if they hear these noisy or know the large booking especially young people they should control them, otherwise hotel was good. Close to the the Paddy's market and we also visited the Flemington markets and the train was close and easy to get to. The hotel room was a bit small as there was 6 of us but I found it very clean. If I went to Sydney again would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pom78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aarons for 10 nights in Sept 2003. After staying at the Central YHA for 3 nights we decided to move to Aarons as the price was almost identical and the facilties were better. The room wasn't huge but was (or appeared to be) newly renovated with white painted brick walls and new chocolate brown bedding. The shower was in a seperate room and was very powerful. The breakfast served in the cafe next door was fantastic - cooked to order (not the case in most 3 stars when you normally get buffett). The only downside was that we were at the back of the hotel (no view) and every morning the bin men would collect glasses from the street below. So we were often woken up by the sound of crashing glass but we need to get up and explore anyway. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to stay in Sydney for hostel prices but didn't want to stay in a hostel

Reviews.Title: “happy enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15yr old daughter and nephew shared a large family room last year. While the rooms were rather cramped, they were clean and well priced and we loved the location so close to everything. We have booked there again this April at my daughters request (Paddy's is right across the road).

Reviews.Title: “Poor Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BHR1
Reviews.Content: We booked in for four nights using the internet. The first room we were given was very small with no light in bathroom and smelt of smoke. We were given another room on the second day as the toilet stopped working and they could not fix it, this room was better but next to the lift and a bit noisy. No way is this a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear of this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Olivia055
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 booked a deluxe family room weeks ahead of our arrival. We were quoted a price by phone and were also entitled to a 5% discount and free breakfast. When we arrived, the receptionist was incredibly rude and said we owed them $17 more than the quoted price, with no free breakfast. When we asked to speak to the manager, we were told to wait and 35 minutes later we were told the manager was too busy to see any guests, and had to pay the overcharged price. Not only this, the room was nothing like the photos shown on their website, it was a tiny room and I agree with other users that it was more like a hostel. I would never stay at this hotel again, the staff were very rude and unhelpful and the room was not good value!!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Berrnadette
Reviews.Content: I agree that the internet information is very misleading. We stayed here in Feb. 2005. We reserved a double room and learned upon arrival that meant one double bed. The hotel was full of boat racers but after they left we were moved to a larger room. The location is terribly noisy with large trucks driving by in the night. The bedspreads were stained and only bathtowels were provideid, no washcloths. The good part is the location near Darling Harbor, transportation and Chinatown. The staff was very professional and courteous working under difficult circumstances. We ate the complimentary breakfast which was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: silverstreamgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aarons Hotel in August 2004 and were so disappointed with the accommodation. The windows rattled so loud in the wind we thought they were coming in, the smell in the room was awful and the smell of the cooked breakfasts in the foyer (restaurant) on arrival was dreadful. It made us spend most of our time out and about the sights as the hotel was too dreadful to enjoy! Stay away if you want to enjoy your trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aaron's Hotel Sydney(more like Aaron's Hostel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: meady80
Reviews.Content: I have prebooked this hotel for 2 weeks as I was totally satisfied with the way Aarons is presented on the internet, the rooms do not live up to the advertisement and please can someone advise them to change the picture on the website as it is totally false advertising. I have stayed in other hotels that have been booked on the net but this hotel was very false. It's more of a "ho tel" missing an "s".

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2003 for eight nights and although it is not the Hilton you are not paying Hilton prices.The room was basically furnished but very clean and large enough, staff were polite and in general the place was well presented.The location was excellent though in Chinatown it is only a ten minute walk to the bars of Darling Harbour with light rail and metro even closer. The area is a little frantic but never intimidating and if you like East Asian food you will be in your element.

Reviews.Title: “the room's more like a motel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in 1999. The room smelled of cigarettes(?) or something like that. More like a motel room. Even YHA rooms are much better than this! The location is ok, but once u step out of the door, the street is dirty in that part of town.

HotelInfo.Name: Aarons Hotel Sydney Central
HotelInfo.Address: 37 Ultimo Road, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
